wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Francis Neville Mitchell CB CBE DSO (1904–1954) was a British Army officer who commanded 6th Armoured Division.

link_mentions.page: 20th Armoured Infantry Brigade Combat Team (United Kingdom)

response: Francis Mitchell may refer to one of the following people:

Mitchell married Marion Russell in September 1901, daughter of Dr. Henry Russell. Their eldest son was Major General Francis Mitchell CB CBE DSO. Mitchell lost both his youngest son, Lieutenant-Commander David Reynolds Mitchell DSC DSO, one week before the end of World War II (VE Day), and his brother, Major Charles Johnstone Mitchell DSO, three weeks before the end of World War I (Armistice Day). He was the first cousin of Maj. Douglas Reynolds VC and the uncle of The Very Reverend Patrick Reynolds Mitchell.England, Select Births and Christenings, 1538-1975 He died of pneumonia in 1946 at age 70.Obituary; The Times. Friday, 8 March 1946. Issue 50395, col E, p. 8.
